isis.stitle: ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROL RELAY VALVE: BENDIX ATR-2

svcsection.title: ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROL RELAY VALVE: BENDIX ATR-2

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The ATR-2 Antilock Traction Relay ( Figure 1) is a specialized air brake valve developed for use on Bendix Antilock/Traction equipped tractors only (with bobtail feature).

figure.caption: Figure 1. ATR-2 Antilock Traction Relay Valve

svcproc.para: It is essentially three separate valves working in combination in a single housing. An R-14 style service relay is the base valve and is fitted with a modified cover containing a bobtail tractor brake proportioning valve and a traction control solenoid. The ATR-2 contains both air and electric components and provides both the service braking and traction control (differential braking) functions. A Bendix Antilock Traction controller, such as the EC-16, can be mounted to the ATR-2 or a cover plate can be installed and the antilock controller mounted elsewhere on the vehicle. When an ATR-2 is combined with an antilock traction controller, the resulting assembly is referred to as an antilock traction assembly. For example, when the ATR-2 is combined with the EC-16 electronic controller, the resulting assembly is referred to as an AT-2 antilock traction assembly.

The ATR-2 replaces the standard relay valve used to control the rear axle service brakes and performs the standard relay function during tractor-trailer operation. During tractor bobtail operation, the ATR-2 reduces brake application pressure to the lighter rear axle(s) brakes to improve vehicle controllability and minimize rear axle(s) wheel skid before antilock is required. The ATR-2 provides added vehicle braking control and reduces the number of times antilock is actually needed.

Like the standard relay valve it replaces, the ATR-2 and its attached antilock controller is normally mounted near the service brakes it serves. A mounting bracket, furnished with the valve, permits either frame or cross- member mounting. All air connections on the ATR-2 are identified with cast, embossed letters for ease of identification and installation. The letter identification and air line connections are shown in Table 1 for reference.

svcproc.para: The ATR-2 is part of the R-12 family of relay valves which includes the R-12, R-14, BP-R1, and AR-1. The internal components of the relay portion of all of these valves are interchangeable with the R-12 and therefore the same basic components are used to service all of them.
The ATR-2 crack pressure is 4 psi.
